results.title: Teachers of Tomorrow
results.brief_description: A survey of the training of Victorian Education Department teachers at the Teachers’ Training College, Melbourne, and in Victorian schools; the film is designed to encourage recruiting to the teaching profession in Victoria.

results.title: The Hungry miles
results.creator_credit: Jerome Levy, Keith Gow, Norma Disher and Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit.
results.brief_description: A passionate survey of the struggles and achievements of the Waterside Workers Federation including some striking scenes of the depression (reconstructed by the WWF Film Unit with amateur actors), showing the impact of the economic hardships of the 1930s on the union and its members.

results.title: Dispensing a cure
results.brief_description: One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region. Ian Darling and Doug McColl have each practised pharmacy for over forty years in the Warracknabeal district. In this film they recall the era when most drugs were hand-made on the premises, generally from raw materials. Ian also tells of the mysterious medicine jar labelled ‘ADT’ and of an old-fashioned coin-operated machine for a self administered electric shock.

results.title: Graham Baxter: park ranger
results.creator_credit: Rob Salvatore and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Only a fortunate few live and work in a place as beautiful as this. Wilson’s Promontory Park Ranger Graham Baxter explains why every day for him is a special day in this place ‘for the soul’.

results.title: Handle with care: glass
results.creator_credit: Mohan Wadhwani, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A brief history of the Indian glass industry, contrasting the products of the individual artisan and the modern streamlined factory. To aid the industry, the Government established the Central Glass and ceramic Research Institute in Calcutta to conduct research into new types of glass.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mohan Wadhwani, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Computers as work aids in transport; Impact of computers in local government
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
A compilation of two programs which examine the role of computers at work: 1. Computers as work aids in transport (16 min). - 2. Impact of computers in local government (16 min).

results.title: Creative Activity: Our First Puppet Play
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: A classroom film describing the steps in the production of a puppet play by primary school children. Shows the various stages in production: planning of story and action; choosing puppets; making props and backdrop; preparing stage; allotting parts; rehearsing; finally, the finished puppet show.

results.title: Energy Conservation in the Home
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Energy conservation in the home” provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

See also Related Title 325491 “Victoria’s energy”; uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

results.title: Seeds of change
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Examines changes in Victorian farm life documenting its evolution from horse to tractor to modern machinery. Filmed on location at Jeparit, this program uses period re-creation and documentary footage.
